website_summaries.verdict: Offers a bright, beautiful display, but if accuracy is what you are looking for, others are more reliable.
pros: Stands out for its gorgeous display that provides readings to keep you informed of the latest indoor/outdoor temperatures and more
cons: Has the tendency to lose connection to the outdoor sensor

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older weather station that I'd had for many years, and this one is fantastic. I plugged it into a wall outlet, but have batteries as the backup. The result is a fabulous looking weather station right above my thermostat on my wall. This is probably the best small weather station I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: J. HolstTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Looks amazing and was able to get it mounted in no ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks amazing and was able to get it mounted in no time at all. The station's prediction ability is a little hard to get but it gives you an idea of what you might expect during the day. It is battery powered but is nice to have an option to plug it in. I ran my wire up the wall and in a cable runner that disguised it well and made it look like it belonged where I put it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl B

customer_reviews.title: I ordered three and all were defective
customer_reviews.text: The first unit did not have a working "up" button so it was impossible to program. The interior temperature on the replacement read a constant 82 degrees. We placed another thermometer next to it and the temperature was 72 - 75 degrees. The next replacement did not have a working "up" button either. On all three I called the "technical" department and left a message. I did not receive a call back and I understand why. With all of these problems they must be very busy. THIS IS A JUNK ITEM. DO NOT ORDER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ripbc

customer_reviews.title: AC adaptor didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The AC adaptor didn't work and after receiving a new one from manufacturer, it still didn't work so I returned it. Amazon sent me a could AC adaptors too, but they didn't fit the molding around the female side in the unit because it required a small right-angle male plug. I ended up buying 2 SmartGear Indoor/outdoor weather station model STG-5939-KB. it was on sale locally for 40% off and they are working great so far after about 2months.
customer_reviews.author: gmon

customer_reviews.title: The indoor temp and humidity sensor worked great, but the outdoor sensor we received was 10 ...
customer_reviews.text: First off, the unit is large and the display is attractive. I powered the outdoor sensor and then the unit. The sensor and base unit were in my room for 2 hours. The indoor temp and humidity sensor worked great, but the outdoor sensor we received was 10 points off on humidity and 3 degrees F off from temp. We know this because we also purchased ThermoPro sensor and that sensor's base and outdoor sensor and this unit's base all three reported the same temp and humidity+/- 1 point. Only the outdoor sensor of the LaCrosse unit was bad. I returned this unit and kept the thermopro.
customer_reviews.author: HinNC

customer_reviews.title: Wildly inaccurate temperatures
customer_reviews.text: Like the design, although the light is a bit bright in a bedroom. Unfortunately, neither the indoor nor outdoor temperatures come close to resembling reality. Indoor temps are usually 3-5 degrees cooler than actual, while outdoor temps are anywhere from 12-30 degrees off actual. And it varies by inconsistent amounts. I need something I can count on. It's not this.
customer_reviews.author: Susan in DC

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Set-up was easy...install the batteries and sync the unit. The atomic clock functionality was almost instantaneous but I think that depends on the satellites in the sky. We placed the outdoor sensor on the porch, under one of the eaves, and protected by a metal upright. They sell a protector for it, but man it's like $20 for some plastic. We've had no issues with this unit. It's bright. So bright that it's like a nightlight in the main room. Not a bad thing. Basically this unit has been a 'set it and forget it' weather station. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff  🚑 & Jeff's Wife 💅Top Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: never automaticaly sets the time
customer_reviews.text: will not auto set the time. moved the outdoor unit to different sides of the house and tried first floor and second floor locations. tried power off and reset at the different locations. we had satellite tv for years, no reception problems, so this thing should get satellite signals. have needed to move this several times, each time it's powered off, have to manually set the time again. also the rain clouds displayed, and lighting displayed are erratic and display sometimes when the sun is shining and not a cloud in the sky.
customer_reviews.author: pj

customer_reviews.title: bright colors
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to replace a simple La Crosse outside temp model. My family love the different colors. DO NOT "sprinkle" water near it, or the model will quit. If not plugged into the wall, you can not read anything, to dark. This is an "estimated guess" of the weather. Mine will show sun shine and flowers when it's 3 am at night. It shows rain when it's 60 outside. I look at this, get a "concideration of what the weather might be",,, then I go out and look for myself.
customer_reviews.author: 2 plus mom

customer_reviews.title: Bright, easy to read day or night, not as intuitive as it could be.
customer_reviews.text: No one seems to make a decent ceiling projection clock anymore so I gave this unit a try. Pro/con below - Pro: -Easy to read day pr night from 20+ feet away -Outdoor temperatur sensor responds quickly -The "tredning" weather information for the forecast is accurate -Large, bright screen Con: -Keep the instruciton sheet - it's not intuitive -Wish it had moon phases -I had to initially set the time, day and date. I thought teh atomic clock wuld do all of that Short ownership period so far but the clarity and brilliance of this face of this clock alone makes it worth 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: RolidnotTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: NO TECH SUPPORT - DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: My unit arrived in early fall and worked until temps began to drop into 30s F. Instructions warned of battery failuree in low temps but this seemed not right. However, followed instructions and bought Lithium Ion battrteries and watched into winter as dropouts continued. I then went to the company web site and left email as directed but received no reply. Sometime later, I wrote a second time and received no reply. Recently someone suggested I post here. This is unacceptable. I have an Accurate weather station at the other end of the house that has worked flawlessly for years. I will most likely get another of those.
customer_reviews.author: E. Roth

customer_reviews.title: 'Down' Button was defective 2 orders in a row
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product and the first one had a defective 'down' button. However I did like every other aspect of the product, it's display, it's colors, brightness control and many more aspects of this. Because I liked so much of the rest of it, I decided it was worth giving them a 2nd try by ordering again. But, this 2nd unit had the SAME EXACT ISSUE. Needless to say I returned this one as well and decided that it was worth going with a different company's product at this point, because this market has MANY great products from different companies and it's not worth wasting time with a company that seems to have this degree of poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Crappy weather station
customer_reviews.text: I wish this was a positive review because the device is very vivid and readable. But it’s incredibly inaccurate - typically 8-12 degrees off. And the time tends to randomly change to what appears to be any number of time zones. I’ve installed the remote sensor per the instructions but that didn’t seem to make any difference. I would not buy this product again and would think twice about buying anything from this manufacturer in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Kesner

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit I've purchased within the last year or so. Out of the box, there was an issue with both. The first is one of the info screen panels is barely visible. Very dim. Other 5 panels are fine. My most current purchase is the most frustrating. During setup, the up arrow button doesn't work and can't set time/date and other functions. Doesn't seem to know the internet exsists. Even though I set the unit right next to my router. In both cases, the units work well enough that it's not worth the hassle of returning them. I just wished they worked as they should for thee price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing goes through 2 AA batteries every 4 to 5 days on the sensor that goes outside for the outside temp readings. It is too intensive for the battery power allocated it by its design. So unless you own shares in Duracell you are tossing away your money continuously to keep it able to function.
customer_reviews.author: Dhraey

customer_reviews.title: Poor Amazon Service
customer_reviews.text: The unit worked well for about 35 days. Then the outside temp/humidity sensor stopped working. Tried replacing the batteries multiple times; to no avail. Amazon Tech Services was useless while keeping us on hold for over an hour, then indicating we should speak with a Lacrosse tech representative. Amazon tried for 20 minutes and could not reach a representative. She then suggested we call Lacrosse. There is No Lacrose Representative. Very unhappy with Amazon for putting us through this ordeal especially since we are prime members and company shareholders. Would have expected Amazon to ship a replacement sensor in exchange for the defective unit.
customer_reviews.author: Norman H

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very colorful. Adding to previous review after several months. I thought I'd like it, but it is VERY busy. Hard to pick out just what you want at a glance. And the backup batteries? Does not actually back up the unit in a power failure. It may keep all the old data, but if you're dependent on batteries, you will see nothing. IMO, that is a HUGE problem for a casual user. I am VERY disappointed and wish I had bought something else. I'm sure it's great for what it is and does, but it's not for me. So look for the time and date. If that is important to you, don't buy this item. I bought a SkyScan replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Varley M.

customer_reviews.title: Large, Bright Display
customer_reviews.text: Large Bright Display which is what I wanted; however, when it arrived yesterday, I popped two fresh AA batteries into the sensor unit and hung it outside per instructions. It does not work. Addtionally,I am having trouble with setting the date, day, etc. I have ordered some lithium ion AA batteries and will substitute those in the sensor when they arrive. If it doesn't work then, it's going back. Update: I tried the new lithium ion batteries in the sensor/remote today and it still won't transmit the outdoor temp. It is going back. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: valady

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and easy to use unit
customer_reviews.text: This is our second La Crosse Forecast Station. The first one lasted 18 months, which I am satisfied with considering we live in the harsh heat climate of Florida. I suspected that the remote unit went bad, but for the price difference of $15, we bought a complete new unit. When testing the remote unit along-side the interior unit, there was a consistent 1 degree discrepancy. We use this unit to help monitor the temperature in the yard for our dogs. They love to play, but need to be inside when the temperatures get too high.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit, but won't survive a power surge
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed all the features of this unit for about one month. I really couldn't find anything I disliked about it. Then we lost power due to a wind storm. When the power finally came back on the power surge fried the unit. Yeah, everything should be on surge protectors right? Well, nothing in my house, which I can easily navigate at night due to all the little electronics lights everywhere, is plugged into surge protectors and this is the only thing that fried. My alarm clock, which was plugged into the same outlet, is just fine. So, this seems to be a good unit, but make sure you protect it from power surges.
customer_reviews.author: West Texas

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I love that the forecast station gives both indoor and outdoor temps and humidity. The display is large and easy to read. Overall, the station is attractive. The exterior monitor was easy to mount and has a good range. For me, the only downside is that the station lights the entire living room at night! If I dim the display, it is too faint to read during the day from any distance at all. Too bad the brightness option is limited to bright or dim.
customer_reviews.author: MaryB

customer_reviews.title: Deficient design
customer_reviews.text: This weather station looks fine but there are problems. The worst is that the hygrometers both in and out don't go below 19%. I live in Las Vegas and the outside relative humidity dips well below 10% on many days. Dazzling looks don't make up for it's deficiencies. Also La Crosse has made it's customer service nearly impossible to contact. There is no online contact and calls are never answered. You leave your number and they get back to you in 3 days. They make deficient products and are not accountable.
customer_reviews.author: DanC

customer_reviews.title: La Crosse Technology Wireless Atomic Digital Color Forecast Station...
customer_reviews.text: La Crosse Technology Wireless Atomic Digital Color Forecast Station looks good, this is the 2nd one since the 1st one’s up button wasn’t working and you could hear something floating around the inside. It has everything I wanted in a weather station except maybe the barometric pressure... The instructions are lacking slightly in explaining ALL the functions but I’ll figure it out hopefully. Time will tell how it holds up, I’ll try and update this as time goes by...
customer_reviews.author: Raa

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two and they agree nicely and do not compete wifi wise. I have has the remotes and base running on NiMh 20 year old rechargables for six months on one charge. 1.2 V is fine for them, The OLED is display is gorgeous, and the machines take almost no power. One negative. One came with a bad charger, and La Crosse has terrible customer service, and did not replace it. I use a flashlight charger for that one.
customer_reviews.author: Calspete

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous but doesn’t display weather accurately
customer_reviews.text: It’s a beautiful clock. I love how bright it is. The display is gorgeous and I love the colours. The only draw back is the same issue everyone else has mentioned: the weather isn’t accurate. I was hoping that it was showing rain as in it will rain in the future, but it’s only been sunny. It has done this a few times. I wonder if the signal/satellite is receiving from a different part of town? Anyways, besides the weather part, it’s a great clock.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well, and we enjoy all the information it provides
customer_reviews.text: We live in a rural area, so don't have an official weather station to compare this too, but we kept our old manual thermometer on the wall to compare it against and it seemed to be pretty close. We compare to the weather forecast from the closest reporting town and we feel like we are right in there. We love the humidity level reading and are enjoying the weather station in general.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany F.

customer_reviews.title: Good fun at a nice price
customer_reviews.text: I concur with the users that reported difficulty reading the screen at many angles, so only 4 stars. However, it does foot the bill for what I wanted at a low price point. I used alkaline batteries and if the unit isn't plugged in, the screen will dim to conserve battery power. When plugged in, it stays lit. I also read some complaints the indoor temp is inflated if the screen is illuminated constantly... come on. If you're looking for that kind of accuracy, you're at the wrong price point. I've not noticed an appreciable difference. Easy to use, fun animations, great price.
customer_reviews.author: rick8671

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of this that lasted about 10 years so when it croaked this brand became my first choice. My neighbor saw it and liked it so much I bought one for his birthday. Nice looking and very accurate. Had to shade the outside sensor for late afternoon sun. If you can find a shady area to mount it that would be good otherwise direct sun will give you very high and inaccurate readings.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.text: This weather station has an outdoor sensor that tells you what the temperature is outside your home. Unfortunately, it died after just a few months of use. Nothing would get it to work again: new batteries, moving it to a new location. I would definitely say that this product was not made well as the forecast shows rain, but I have clear skies for weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: ive had this weather station for a little over a year now and still love it. Tells indoor and outdoor temp and humidity. I keep mine plugged in all the time so the display stays all the time. You wont be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Broke upon opening box!
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's junk! U/Down button was inoperable from the start, could only go down when adjusting date/time, how do I get to 2018 when it starts at 2013 with only down working!! Don't be fooled by numberous photos indicating no wires! You have to have it plugged in, batteries are only for backup. I did want true wireless, even if it meant going through batteries often. I'm sending it back with exact replacement and will see if that unit has working buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Wolverine

customer_reviews.title: This was an excellent purchase...
customer_reviews.text: I had a different brand I purchased on a clearance a few years ago. It was black & white, just showed the time & temps, till the outside thermometer finally gave out. This was a great replacement, and worth ever penny. I did have to have a friend make a custom stand for it, though, as it sits on a shelf, and is very touchy about the angle. Now it stands perfectly vertical, and I can read it from anywhere in the room. Bought one as a Christmas gift for someone, too, was so pleased with it. I would definitely recommend this, I am extremely pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: stardust7

customer_reviews.title: Buttons are very low quality. Break quickly.
customer_reviews.text: The outside sensor should be put in the shade if possible. Otherwise you get the heat of the direct sunlight giving you a false reading. The buttons are a very low quality. The stopped working shortly after purchase. The manufacturer sent me a brand new unit, but the dimmer button stopped working within a few uses. This kind of tells me the poor quality of the entire unit. Not even worth $5 let alone its retail.
customer_reviews.author: Diantane

customer_reviews.title: Great weather station for my wants
customer_reviews.text: There are many, many reviews concerning the pluses vr's the minus's that should be considered before you purchase this model. So, do yourself a favor and read some of the reviews. My main concern was knowing what the humidity level was indoors. Humidity is a breeding ground for many unwanted "houseguests", molds, mildews, dust mites, germs (such as the common cold, flu viruses), carpenter ants, and even the materials your house is made of. The unit satisfies what I wanted in a nice color display that I run on the account mode constantly and only use the battery mode for power outages.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy and seems to be accurate. However the atomic clock will not sync on our regional signal, which is not the reason I purchased this weather station anyway. It could be the signal strength of the station or the sensitivity of the receiver. Other atomic clocks work find here. Its easy to read the large digital display, I keep it plugged in and on low intensity. The remote sensor is about 70 feet away and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: JimmieJo

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor Temp Failed after 2 weeks (new lithium battery and only 7 feet away)
customer_reviews.text: I love the display itself. I used a brand new (and expensive) lithium batteries in the outdoor sensor and mounted it next to the window by the counter where display unit sets (7 feet apart... if even that much). After only 2 weeks the outdoor temp failed so all it is really good for now is indoor tems. Fortunately I am within the return period ($48 is lot to throw away after only 2 good weeks). I love the display enough that Im am considering trying again... probably a bad idea though. I sure wish they would invest even a tad more in quality.
customer_reviews.author: DSY33

customer_reviews.title: Great product but read the instructions!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product at an affordable price. The distance on the wireless transmitter is ridiculously long. The other reviews on here are people who didn't read the directions and got the transmitter wet! Just hang it in a location where it's outside in the shade where it won't get wet! That's it! The only thing I would advise is the indoor temp reading is 1 degree higher than other temp gauges in the same proximity either because of the unit itself or the backlight. Doesn't make a difference to me!
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: would be nice if there was a dimmer display option
customer_reviews.text: Overall just okay. Our outside thermometer gave out within a few weeks so cannot tell the outside temperature. There are three light preferences for the display screen... off, dim light, and bright light. However, even the dim light is way too bright for nighttime use while sleeping, so we have to turn off the display completely; would be nice if there was a dimmer display option. Cannot configure the clock to CST; keeps switching back to a different time zone (and yes, we read the directions). Would return this product if we had kept the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this station approx. 2 weeks. Worked good for a week and then the outside temp, hum, dew, stopped registering. Tried new batteries in both pieces but still won't work only for inside temp and time. Piece of crap! If I were to send it back it would cost more than it's worth! Read many reviews on it before purchasing it and should have listened to them. Looks like others are having same problem. Worked fine till outside unit was exposed to any weather conditions, rain etc.
customer_reviews.author: Clair Beeman

customer_reviews.title: Remote Temp sensor is worthless
customer_reviews.text: After trying to get the remote temp sensor to work for the last 6 months, I have given up. The remote is less than 10 feet away from the base with a 4 inch wood/sheet rock and vinyl siding in between. Nothing to block it. With no interaction with the base or the sensor, it works about 10% of the time. If I actively try to make it work, I have no improvement in the rate. I am using lithium batteries in the sensor. I previously had a different La Crosse weather monitor that worked for 8 years with no major issues. This one simply does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Cha

customer_reviews.title: EH...
customer_reviews.text: Temps and humidity are nice, alarms useless, bright and dim are nice. Biggest problems: 1/ the green color used for the clock section is unreadable even bright. 2/ the barometer just doesn't measure right at all, sunny outside and it shows rain, even that night, showed rain, but no rain, the next day, sunny again, it showed rain. Barometer just not accurate. I even waited several weeks thinking it had to figure out where I lived, but no, still inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Right on temps
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to see , bought this for my parents, don’t know how accurate barometer is because I don’t understand how to read one , but , Sometimes it does show clouds when there’s not a cloud in the sky so I don’t know how accurate it could be but the temperature seems to be right on and it is very nice looking the colors are all great easy to turn on works very well as far as temperature
customer_reviews.author: Shawn j thomas

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!!  Great at first, but you'll need to buy a new one every 6 months!
customer_reviews.text: This product is good but does not last! I've purchased several for myself and my sons and the outside sensor only lasts a few months. No amount of rebooting, trouble shooting or new batteries can extend the life. I give up. Can somebody recommend a similar product that lasts a bit longer!!~
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Fricchione

customer_reviews.title: Nice Large Screen, Easy to Read and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: August 1, 2018 Remote Sensor Quit Working after 6 Months -- We updated to this color unit from our old black'n'white monitor (10+ years) that is still going strong, just wanted something a little more fancy. This model (La Crosse 308-1414B) has a real nice large screen, it's easy to read and accurate. Comparing temperatures inside and out against our old unit they are the same (within .1 - .3 degrees). We also like the viewing angle, very easy to read from a side view. We are thinking about purchasing another one for our son.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy Gramps

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO  READ
customer_reviews.text: I AM COLOR BLIND AND I PURCHASED THIS ITEM DUE TO WHITE NUMBER OF IN/OUT TEMPS. THAT I CAN EASILY SEE. OTHER PRESENTED INFORMATION DO NOT MATTER, AS I CAN NOT SEE THE COLOR PRESENTED. I AM WELL PLEASED WITH THIS ITEM AS NUMBERS ARE LARGE ENOUGH FOR OLD EYES. YOU DO NEED TO LOOK DIRECTLY AT THE DISPLAY, AS SEEN FROM AN ANGLE THE INFO DISAPPEARS. B
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best, Brightest unit on the Market for the Money; and has Atomic Clock
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through many home weather stations through the years looking for 'the one': balancing price against features and performance. Also, my experience has been that its difficult to find a unit that has a display that is bright enough to read across the room. This unit does well across many fronts. The temperature readings are consistent and it doesn't drop communication from its satellite sending unit(s), AND it has an atomic clock. It also has one of the brightest displays I have ever encountered, easily readable from across the room. For the money, this is the best unit out there.
customer_reviews.author: mazinman

customer_reviews.title: No complaints at all
customer_reviews.text: Wow this thing is bright enough to see across the room in daylight! The definition is crystal clear, and the accuracy seems to be dead on. One thing, if you run it on batteries, it will only be this bright on demand (when you press the top button), if you use the AC adapter, it is bright 24/7, which is convenient for use as a nightlight.
customer_reviews.author: DPAZ

customer_reviews.title: The best of four weather stations I've purchased over the past ten years.
customer_reviews.text: Display is a little larger but the numbers are much larger making this station easier to read from accoss the room. This display is also visible vs. previous stations from almost all angles. Previous stations had poor displays that only allowed visibility from certain angles. I've only owned this for about a month but so far it's better that all previous purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

customer_reviews.title: Temperature and Humidity Reads Accurately.  "Tendency" is Basically Worthless
customer_reviews.text: The internal and external temps and humidity are reasonably accurate. The outdoor sensor has a long range and a pretty decent battery life. If all you are looking for are "is it hot? Is it humid", then this is a great product. If you expect it to tell you if it's going to be raining or sunny, this ain't it.
customer_reviews.author: Baloney

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor sensor battery life is not good.
customer_reviews.text: First, I want to say that I like the colorful display. It gives a lot of detailed information in an easy to read format. Setup was pretty easy. But, the battery life of the remote temp/humidity sensor lasts maybe a month or less. I have had other sensors batteries last 6 months or more. The sensor is mounted on an inside wall of a roof covered porch so it's not like it is getting wet. But with a remote temp/humidity sensor that I have to change the batteries in a month or less, it's not very practical.
customer_reviews.author: Volkin

customer_reviews.title: Works well once we got a functional unit.
customer_reviews.text: Our replacement weather station has been working well for 10 days. Unfortunately the first unit we received had two of the setting buttons completely non-functional. A phone call to Lacrosse got a replacement on the way. This model has much better set-up instructions and much quicker pairing of the remote sensor than our previous experience with other brands. The temperature readings are very accurate and the humidity readings seem to at least trend correctly (we have no independent humidity measurements). The weather "prediction" (based on ambient pressure trends) needs 8 days to self-calibrate, so I can't comment on its right-wrong percentage yet. The screen is bright and readable when plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Flemming

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking weather station if it worked. Battery backup does not work, apparently a defective unit. Will order another one once I get my refund and will update when I get it. Update: Changed to one star. Got another one and it lost communication with the outdoor sensor as soon as the sensor was brought outside. Fresh batteries and the two units were only about 30 feet apart. Sent it back and ordered the Acurite station. And for about $40 more I got wind speed, direction and rain gage.
customer_reviews.author: Lou F

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This weather station is great to have. It is very convenient and super easy to set up and seems to be fairly accurate. The only odd thing about it is the center part where it shows the weather "tendency". Sometimes it will show rain when there is none around. I suppose it means it could possibly rain sometime soon but it has been dry here for weeks! I would still recommend it for the clock and temperatures alone.
customer_reviews.author: K.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I use it almost everyday. It's awesome to see the difference double paneled windows make. It allows me to see if there's any advantage to open the windows to cool the house down when I get back from work. It also lets me know thr humidity to see if I should use the portable AC unit or the Swamp Cooler. It would've been awesome if it worked only on batteries so you could hang it on the wall without any cables. For this I took one star out. If you don't mind this, then it's a 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: LaCrosse finally got it right
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying weather stations for several years. Many of them didn't even work out of the box and those that did work usually quit working within 6 months. This includes Lacrosse. But this model they finally got their act together. It is easy to read, easy to use and after a years I have had NO PROBLEMS with it!
customer_reviews.author: Jasper

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied with La Crosse Weather Station 308-1414B.
customer_reviews.text: Very Satisfied with La Crosse Weather Station 308-1414B. The first unit I received had an issue with the backlight not staying lit but after I contacted customer service the issue was taken care of right away....quickly! I was so impressed with the quality of the customer service. This product is great. The readings have been accurate and the display is colorful and easy to read. I highly recommend this unit, it meets all of my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Charlson

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 2-3 months, all downhill from there!
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this weather station for the first few months and then the sensor would frequently malfunction. Talked to customer support who explained how to reset the system so that the display would again read the outdoor sensor output. This technique worked for a few more months.... Now the reset doesn’t work and the display is only capable of reading the indoor temperature. To top it off, I cannot get a hold of the warranty/replacement department. JUNK! Don’t waste your money! UPDATE: Replacement sensor they sent me doesn’t work either. SO IRRITATING!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Chimiak

customer_reviews.title: All the basic info on one screen and Very easy to read!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the elderly with sight issues! Love the big screen and can easily read the temp from across the room. The remote sensor paired flawlessly and at 50-60 feet away and thru 1910 solid rock plaster walls it shows full strength. I also bought the Rain Shield and nailed it onto the side of a tree. Not sure if that can skew the humidity, but so far doesn't seem to at about 6’ high off the ground.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Terrable! The Forcast machine doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible product. The clock is the only thing that works. Outdoor temperature is wrong by a lot. The sun is shining, but it shows rain. Unbelievable! The return date has expired. That is my fault. I have had other stations before (don't remember the manufacturer) purchased from Walmart. They worked fine. I left them when i moved.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great little weather station/clock
customer_reviews.text: Great little weather station/clock.... worked right out of the box for me. Put the batteries in the outdoor sensor and placed on my upper deck outside of master bedroom. Plugged the unit in, I did have to manually set the time and date but other than that started getting readings straight away which coincided with an outdoor thermometer and my indoor thermostat. Colorful and does what you need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Ella Arey

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We have had it a week now. Transmitter is about 100' feet away Works just fine. Easy set up. The really worked with real people when they designed this We like it a lot. Will see how it performs in the Minnesota winter - which is starting now darn it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bear Paw

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Screen size nice, about six inches across, like a small tablet, although not viewable unless close. Large color letter display, and easy to read close up. Seems to be accurate. A little tricky to set up. My device has had two days to sync with master atomic clock, and so far hasn’t been able to detect. Keep out of direct sun light or it will read hot.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Love the display and info provided on it but hate ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the display and info provided on it but hate that after a little over a month, the outside temp started losing connection. I have the Li-Ion batteries installed in the outside sending unit but makes no difference. Brought within If it didn't disconnect all the time, I'd give it 5, but the outside temp is main reason for buying this and now I have to return to MFG. I should've listened to other reviews who had same prob., but I said "not me" mine will be fine.....not so. Disappointed. Going to try doing a factory reset on it. If that works, I'll update the review.
customer_reviews.author: WLM

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to tell abut the screen size when looking at a picture on the internet, the screen is a bit small. The clock can be difficult to read if you need to wear glasses, and without glasses, you will not see the time from more than just a few feet away. The device is easy to set up, simple to operate and hands free once it is up and running.
customer_reviews.author: Mad_Dog

customer_reviews.title: Step down from older unit
customer_reviews.text: My older lacrosse didn’t need a power supply to be able to see the screen. The batteries lasted 6-8 months and I could see clearly from 20 ft away also the outdoor remotes keeps disconnecting and it is closer than my other lacrosse This ones is very very dim and needs to have the power supply to keep it lit. Will probably return this unit not happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Ronhauck

customer_reviews.title: Great Simple Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: This is my second La Crosse- the first was a simpler B&W one that has been going for three years with no issues. I moved it into the bedroom and replaced it with this one (in the living room). Fairly easy setup, great colors, clear, easy to read, and the information it gives seems to be accurate. All the buttons are where they belong, No buyer's remorse here.
customer_reviews.author: Olddude

customer_reviews.title: Using batteries only a bit better, can not adjust backlight
customer_reviews.text: spent hours trying to get this to work. AC adaptor will not work at all. Using batteries only a bit better, can not adjust backlight. Jumping up on the couch every time I want to know the time, pushing the darn button is not going to work. Unit will NOT stay on, you must push a button each and every time you want to see the time or weather. POS right out of the box. Please refund my money and send a return box for this.
customer_reviews.author: G. Herman

customer_reviews.title: Great Weather Station / Superb Support From Amazon Support
customer_reviews.text: The first weather station had a problem with two buttons but a quick call to Amazon's Support, a special number just for this weather station, and they returned my call in less than a minute. The support person diagnosed the problem and issued an order for a replacement. The replacement works 100% and is the best and easiest to use weather station that we have ever had. We highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: L&J

customer_reviews.title: Good little weather station
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife so she no longer has to wonder what the temp is outside when she dresses in the morning for her workout. we have ours in the back yard under the deck and away from the sunlight for accurate readings. It is easy to set up and works great. If I were to recommend buying another one, get the full weather package with all of the options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... that it's sunny and cloudy at the same time pretty much all the time
customer_reviews.text: It says that it's sunny and cloudy at the same time pretty much all the time. Wish it had a barometer reading instead. Also, the outdoor sensor should have come with a screw to mount it. Update: Most of the buttons on the top no longer work, so I can no longer set the time/date. I have had this for less than 2 years. Also, there is a pretty large inconsistency between what the temperature is reported outside on the display, and what the people on the local news are reporting.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty disappointed. I wanted this clock because I want to keep track of the temperature inside and out without having to check the weather app or my thermometer. I loved all the features listed on this clock's description, but so far, the clock won't stay on unless I have it plugged in (what's the point of having a bunch of batteries inside if you can't use it without the power cord?), the outside temperature gauge doesn't work, despite having changed the batteries multiple times and placing it all over the place in case it was a location-to-clock problem. So basically I bought an expensive, bright alarm clock.
customer_reviews.author: sorrowsangel89

customer_reviews.title: The Best weather station ever!
customer_reviews.text: We had a La Crosse weather station that died. It would have cost us more to fix it than to get a new one. The one we got was really good and because my husband likes having one in the bedroom I got a second one. It is very colorful gives us all the info we want & has three light levels which is very nice, as I really don't like ambient light in our bedroom, so it gets turned off at nigh.
customer_reviews.author: Danny's Gal

customer_reviews.title: in color, works well and big numbers
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement for my weather channel one I had for 12 yrs that died. This is in color, big numbers, is accurate and works well. Also you can put in batteries in case the power goes out Costs like $30 or $40, I don't remember but worth every penny. I would buy this again. Also arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Harper

customer_reviews.title: TV weather is more accurate
customer_reviews.text: Something has changed. This is the second one that did not work. After 24 hours in the house the indoor temp was correct but the outdoor sensor was 30 degrees higher. Put it outside and again the outdoor sensor read way off. Had the same type at our old house for many years and never such an inaccuracy
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Great Indoor/Outdoor thermometer with many features!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I have used LaCross for years now, and this is the best one yet! Easy to program, and outdoor sensor compares with my outdoor mercury thermometer. Display is easy to read and interpret, and has “dimmable” features.
customer_reviews.author: headbanger

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed in this
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these, one for me and one for my GrSon.. both of them have problems. Have to change the batteries about once a month and sometimes sooner. I wish I had known. The batteries that have to be replaced are the ones in the unit for outside. We go thru quite a few AA batteries a mo. So disappointed in this.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: The display is nice and the set up was easy but...... It's completely inaccurate. The sensor was set up outside per the instructions. The displayed outside temperature was off between 10-12 degrees all the time. I tested it against three other thermometers that were all within a degree or two of each other. It never was accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Gaul

customer_reviews.title: A Worthless Purchase
customer_reviews.text: The time I spent talking to the manufacturer was greater than the time their product was live. They sent me instructions to test and reset their product but it never performed as advertised. They first said the walls of my house were blocking the signal but testing the item inside proved their product was worthless unless I placed the outside sensor on the counter within three feet of the base station. I returned it and bought an AcuRite weather station which has performed without interruption since it was installed.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor accuracy should be better.
customer_reviews.text: Have had for a month. Only issue I have is the accuracy of outdoor temperature. It is routinely registering 5-7 degrees off from two other thermometers I have. Other two are within 1 degree of each other. This one low in mornings and higher in afternoon temps. Love the bright large indoor display. I have relocated the sensor outside three times an no change. BUT, for my use it is not a deal killer. Iam a weather nerd, and wish it would run closer temps to my other twp units. One being a Davis weather station.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This weather station is perfect! The screen is bright enough to see across the room. It's nice to be able to just look up whenever we want to see the temp and know what it is. Plus we had been thinking our house thermometer was off by a few degrees and this proved that. My husband said it was his favorite Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: S.M.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk..
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of junk..don't waste your money or time..I've called and spoken with an agent who was somewhat helpful, he had me take all the batteries out push any key on top 20 times reistall batteries in the sensor and plug into AC power..unit came on for about twenty minutes then went out agin..does not report or read outside temperature..I through away the box this piece of junk came in or I'd return to Amazon.. BTY Amazon is great unfortunately not.all the products they sell are all good.. Go to Home Depot lowest and buy one if it does work you can all ways take it back...JUNK..
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Not accurate. The sun display was on all the time even though it was raining. The clouds constantly moved back and forth. Indoor temp was 70 but it read 79. Directions to set up were followed exactly as written and sensor was right outside window. We waited the recommended amount of time for unit to calibrate, but it never worked. Pretty display but what is the point if it didn’t work? Returned unit and will purchase a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weather at a glance
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It shows the outside and inside temps and humidity, and a fun little icon predicts rain, cloudiness, sunshine or snow based on humidity and temperature. The temp data appears to be very accurate. It's a colorful addition to the living room. One note: We had a slight problem with the original and requested a replacement. They shipped it to us without waiting to receive the defective one. We received it two days later and it works like a dream. Highly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Cantwell

customer_reviews.title: Nice bright display and dead accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for 3 days but am amazed at how well it works. I put the external sensor on the wall on my covered front porch and it has been dead on with internal and external temps and humidity. The barometric forecasting has also been dead on told me it was going to rain a couple hours before it did whn I wasn't expecting rain. The display is bright and easy to read even in direct light. If this holds up it will be one of my best buys.
customer_reviews.author: Neil L Larson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a christmas gift. It arrived in a brown box and not the original box. It looks like a cheap knockoff. You don't know what's inside until you take it all out of the box. Really disappointed to pay 50.00 for this.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Marie Jirasek

customer_reviews.title: You need this in your life.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. I never have any problems with knowing what the temperature is outside and in. I love that there is a brightness adjustment. My only issue is I wish the clock was a little bit bigger, other than that I would definitely recommend and buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: issackrj

customer_reviews.title: A great buy!
customer_reviews.text: The first surprise was how large this was - I missed the dimensions before ordering, but the overall size and font size are perfect. The amount of information it supplies is awesome. I've used the outdoor remote sensor the past few days to monitor how hot a car gets in direct sun - and was surprised at how far away it works, through the glass of the car and further through the walls of my house - a distance of about 50 feet. So far, very pleased and see no negatives whatsoever!
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Outback Kampers

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and has all the information you will need
customer_reviews.text: They look great, aren't too cluttered with information you don't really need, can easily be seen across a room, and are accurate. I have bought four of these weather stations for myself and family. It is always fun when everyone is texting a snapshot of theirs and the extreme weather they are having around the US and everyone has the same station.
customer_reviews.author: Kiel

customer_reviews.title: Generally Works Well Except During Cold Weather -  Overstates Outdoor Temperature
customer_reviews.text: Very colorful and easy to read (except for the time of day which is too small to read from across the room). Works well except during sub-32 degree weather - outdoor thermometer reading overstates some 4 to 5 degrees compared to two other outdoor thermometers I have. For example, yesterday it said it was 34.9 degrees but the bird baths were frozen solid. Measured "low temperature" was also 34.9. I did use lithium batteries (as some suggested) for the outdoor unit, so that is not the problem. Disappointed by this but otherwise pleased. There does not appear to be any way to calibrate this Unit.
customer_reviews.author: R. W. Gorham

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit, easy to set up, easy to read and reasonable in price. Fairly accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A

customer_reviews.title: Made well
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for over 6 months now and it's working like a charm. This is the first clock with remote, outside sensors that didn't stop working out of 4 others. I like the way it looks and have only needed to replace a few batteries once now. I glance at it multiple times a day making this one of the most used purchases I've made this past year.
customer_reviews.author: Austemagne

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product! Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I use this weather station every day. I live on the side of a mountain and can not get a good read on the weather from newspapers, television, radio or the internet. This little gem is the answer. Display is easy to read and looks stylish. You don't need to be a meteorologist to use it. Indoor and outdoor temperatures and humidity, trends (rising, steady lowering) and alerts you set to your preferences. Can't say enough good things about this weather station.
customer_reviews.author: Whiskey Dick

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I've had a smaller La Crosse before and was extremely pleased with it's performance. That's what prompted me to buy a new, more informative unit. I haven't been disappointed and I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the display.
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit. Was very easy to set up, but had a problem with the android software displaying correctly. I emailed the company and they reset my software and now working properly. The main unit with the wind and rain transmitter comes with a mounting bracket but the plastic riser pipe is not long enough to get the unit high enough above the roof when the is snow on the roof.
customer_reviews.author: AJH

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this device while it worked. The display is nice (as long as you use AC adapter) and it is clear and easy to read. I never had any issues with the sensors. After about 14 months, I came home to a blank display. It was blank WITH or WITHOUT batteries or with new batteries alone. Display failed even with new AC adapter. Outside of warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Palya Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay connected to sensor
customer_reviews.text: This looks great and I really wish it worked, but the main unit won't stay connected to the sensor, even when right next to each other. I figured maybe I had got it wet so I bought a new sensor and the enclosure, but it still won't stay connected, even when they are right next to each other.
customer_reviews.author: Philly Blunt

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to see when lit up
customer_reviews.text: I love the easy to read display. I like to look at outdoor temp first thing in the am before I go out to feed my horses. The only negative thing is if it isn't plugged into the ac outlet the screen isn't lit up and you can't see it. It has batteries for back up but doesn't light up.
customer_reviews.author: Ncreiner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome weather clock
customer_reviews.text: Great clock ,I love everything this does and no issues with performance or accuracy everyone should have one
customer_reviews.author: Wickedblood

customer_reviews.title: A great piece of kit.
customer_reviews.text: This item is working great. I really enjoy it. My only complaint is that the viewing angle is limited. You almost need to be looking at it head on to see the display correctly. I have another La Crosse item that is over 10 years old and it is one digit lower in temp reading and working great. I am very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: N/A

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this company
customer_reviews.text: The outdoor sensor signal does is not read by the weather station no matter what I do: relocate, quick start, factory reset, etc... I called the company customer support and they put me on an automated system and then asked me to leave a message with my name, phone number and unit model number. I gave them that information and, as you can imagine, no response whatsoever. Very disappointed with this company; sending back and will not purchase on of their products again.
customer_reviews.author: RED McGuire

product_meta.title: La Crosse Technology 308-1414B-INT, Black 308-1414B Wireless Atomic Digital Color Forecast Station with Alerts
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style Name:StationFull color display gives you current temperatures & humidity, with a future forecast whether it could be sunny or rainy to snowy. Features accurate, self-set atomic time & date with automatic DST updates. Records min/max values and alerts you of extreme temperatures. Also displays your heat index and dew point. Will indicate of low battery and reception strength. Batteries required (not included.).Weather Station Factory Restart Explanation: The factory restart returns the weather station and outdoor sensor to an ?out-of-the-box? default state and often resolves an issue. Factory Restart: 1. Remove all power (batteries and AC) from outdoor sensor and weather station. 2. Press one of the buttons on the weather station at least 20 times to clear all memory. 3. Verify that the weather station is blank before proceeding (there may be lines painted on the screen that will show when there is no power). 4. Leave both units without power for 15 minutes (very important). 5. Insert the AC power cord into the wall outlet then into the weather station. 6. Insert fresh batteries into the outdoor sensor. 7. Press the TX button on the outdoor sensor to transmit RF signal. 8. Keep the outdoor sensor 5-10 feet from the weather station. 9. When RF connection is established, the temperature will appear on the station. Allow the outdoor sensor and weather station to sit together for 15 minutes to establish a strong connection. 10. Do not press buttons for 15 minutes. For optimum 433MHz transmission, place the outdoor sensor no more than 300 feet (91 meters, open air) from the weather station Explanation: The factory restart returns the weather station and remote sensor to an “out-of-the-box” default state and often resolves an issue. Factory Restart: 1. Remove all power (batteries and AC) from remote sensor and weather station. 2. Press one of the buttons on the weather station at least 20 times to clear all memory. 3. Verify that the weather station is blank before proceeding (there may be lines painted on the screen that will show when there is no power). 4. Leave both units without power for 15 minutes (very important). 5. Insert the AC power cord into the wall outlet then into the weather station. 6. Insert fresh batteries into the remote sensor. 7. Press the TX button on the remote sensor to transmit RF signal. 8. Keep the remote sensor 5-10 feet from the weather station. 9. When RF connection is established, the temperature will appear on the station. Allow the remote sensor and weather station to sit together for 15 minutes to establish a strong connection. 10. Do not press buttons for 15 minutes. • For optimum 433MHz transmission, place the remote sensor no more than 330 feet (100 meters, open air) from the weather station. Note: In Mounting/Positioning Remote sensor First: Place the remote sensor in the desired shaded location and the weather station in the home. Wait approximately 1 hour before permanently mounting the remote sensor to ensure that there is proper reception. POSITION Outdoor: • Protect the remote sensor from standing rain or snow and from the overhead sun, which can cause it to read incorrectly. • Mounting under an eave or deck rail works well. • If you choose, you can construct a small roof or box for the remote sensor. Be sure a box has vents. • Mount the remote sensor on the North side where to prevent sun from causing incorrect readings. • Mount at least 6 feet in the air for a strong RF (radio frequency) signal. • Do not mount the remote sensor on a metal fence. This significantly reduces the effective range. • Remote sensors are water resistant, not waterproof
feature_bullets: Full color LCD with weather icons: sunny, partly sunny, cloudy, rainy, stormy, snowy
Monitors indoor & wireless outdoor temperature (f/c) & humidity (%RH) with recorded min/max values
Temperature alerts (indoor/outdoor). Display: 5.0V AC adapter for primary power; Requires 3 "AAA" Alkaline batteries for backup (not included)

Reception & low battery indicators. Indoor humidity range: 19 percentage to 97 percentage RH. Temperatures below - 20°F (-28.8°C) require Lithium batteries in the outdoor sensor.Forecast tendency indicator.Signal strength icon for sensor transmission
Atomic self-setting accurate time & date with automatic daylight saving time resets.Outdoor humidity range: 19% to 97% RH. Indoor humidity range: 19% to 97% RH

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars3,300 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
